attributes.action: Create a virtual parliamentary constituency for serving armed forces personnel.
attributes.background: The choice of voting for the constituency a Serving Member (and his/her family) find themselves in (when based in the UK) or voting for a constituency they had lived in previously is often unsatisfactory.  In my experience serving members don't vote at all and few use their MP.
attributes.additional_details: The creation of a virtual constituency will give serving members of the Armed Forces and their families the opportunity to vote for a person who will directly represent them in Parliament, regardless of where they are based. Critically it will allow the incumbent MP, regardless of party, to immerse him/herself in the specific needs of serving personnel and their families. This role is to be independent of the MoD and the Minister of State for the Armed Forces which reflect Government needs.

attributes.action: Honour  Paralympians & Olympians by declaring an extra bank holiday in 2016
attributes.background: As a comparatively small island together we have come second in the Medals table for the 2016 Olympics, and are currently second in the Paralympics medal table. This is a quite remarkable achievement.
attributes.additional_details: Lets make it happen, and demonstrate that we are proud of their achievements and know how to celebrate.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Remove the pension lifetime allowance.We want to be self-reliant in retirement.
attributes.background: The current  lifetime allowance means we will not have enough pension income  in retirement. We want to have enough income so we are not reliant on the state and with a decent pension income, we will fuel the economy. This makes even more sense as the population is ageing. Please think again!
attributes.additional_details: As an example, a final salary pension of £18k p.a. eats up 58% of the lifetime allowance before any further pension savings are made. It does not leave much headroom and will not equate to extravagant riches in old age. Please reconsider the lifetime allowance limit.

attributes.action: Ban the Prime Minister and Cabinet from receiving cash in exchange for meetings
attributes.background: Prime Minister Theresa May is selling lunch meetings with herself at her 2016 party conference for £3,150.
attributes.additional_details:
See reports in the Guardian https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/02/theresa-may-3150-lunch-democracy-for-sale-lobbyists?CMP=fb_gu 

and the
Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/01/business-leaders-charged-3000-a-head-to-have-lunch-with-theresa/

attributes.action: Manual workers to retire at 60!!
attributes.background:
We work until we drop!! Is that the idea? Myself and my partner are both manual workers and are 57 years old!! We really can't see ourselves being fit to work until we're 66!! Can you? We're ready to drop now.

Please vote.
attributes.additional_details: Manual workers are more at risk for potential damage to limb and arthritis damage so therefore would cost more in the long run for medical deficiency!! Most of us will end up taking sick leave because we can't manage our jobs. Personally I have worked since I was 14 and am now 57. Is this not long enough!!!

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Continuous blood glucose monitoring for Type 1 diabetics to be funded by NHS
attributes.background:
Insulin dependant diabetics have to fund their own continuos monitoring system.
It has been shown to improve HBA1c (blood sugars) dramatically and reduce diabetic side effects such as Amputation, Blindness and Kidney failure. It should be available to every one not just patients who can afford it!
attributes.additional_details:
It will save money over current methods ie finger prick blood glucose monitoring and reduce diabetic side effects and therefore huge costs to the NHS..

see British Diabetic Association etc

attributes.action: Introduce free drug purity test kits into Pharmacies across Britain.
attributes.background: Too many young individuals are taking drugs that in most cases are not what they are said to be, leading to cases of serious harm and often death. Drug consumption is not something that can be stopped, but can be made safer with the introduction of these purity testing kits that could save lifes.

attributes.action: Force Councils to fix the roads throughout England
attributes.background: Within the Northwest alone roads are dangerous cars are avoiding pot holes which in turn could result in a possibly fatal accident. Not only only is this unsafe the overall cost could potentially be higher than if the councils hired someone to fix the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Manchester roads have deep visible cracks which could result in a sink hole, Rochdale roads have potholes inches deep, something needs to be done before an accident occurs.

attributes.action: Charge for GP apptments. Allow GP's to dispense low cost drugs such as aspirin.
attributes.background:
A small charge for visit to GP would deter time wasters & release funds for deserving needs. 
GP's prescribe aspirin and similar drugs costing a few pence which incur standard £10-£12 "Pharmacy handling" charge to the Dept of Health. Curb this waste too and spend on more deserving needs
attributes.additional_details:
From data in the public domain it is evident that many patients fail to attend appointments with virtually no financial penalty. A £5-£10 per person per appointment (with some exceptions) is affordable by the majority of inhabitants.
Prescriptions for low cost (normally over the counter) drugs incur significant "handling" charge. By permitting/instructing GP's to dispense such items the savings can be diverted/used to benefit more urgent demands on the Health Service.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women won’t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Set a goal of landing a person on the Moon by 2050.
attributes.background: A lot of people feel that the United Kingdom no longer has a sense of unity or direction in the wake of the EU referendum. Setting this goal would bring it back, as well as boosting industry and encouraging skilled workers to remain in the UK. It would also help our position as part of ESA.
attributes.additional_details: Only a few countries in the world are capable of launching humans into space and sadly neither the UK nor any member states of the European Space Agency have this capability. By setting this goal we will send a clear message to the world that we are still looking to be at the for front of technical innovation and achievement. It will also raise public awareness of the UK's satellite industry and encourage more people to get involved in science and technology.

attributes.action: Make Not Paying Taxi Fare a Crimnal Offence Oppose to a Civil Matter
attributes.background: When a passenger doesnt pay for a taxi ride either refusing or just simply run away and you call the Police, their response is its a civil matter not a criminal offence. Why is it not a criminal offence. The customer has not paid for a service provided by the taxi driver.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Honour Pharmacy by restricting the number of Pharmacy schools & graduates
attributes.background: Thousands of pharmacy graduates face the possibility of never registering due to the lack of pre-reg training placements available. As a result of the surplus supply of graduates. With many large multiples reducing their commitment to pre-reg training by 50%, making the situation considerably worse.
attributes.additional_details:
It is now vital for sweeping changes to be made. If the current approach is not addressed then sadly Pharmacy "strikes" maybe around the corner. As many dissatisfied professionals feel overworked & undervalued. 

Pharmacy will end becoming an unattractive profession, one incapable of attracting the brightest & the best undergraduates & retaining the newly qualifieds. With supply exceeding demand & universities unethically profiting from it. 

www.the-pda.org/pda-proposes-cutting-student-numbers/

attributes.action: Make braces free for any child with a teeth issue.
attributes.background: Braces are ridiculously expensive, ranging from £1000 to £2000. Any under 18 with a teeth issue should receive free braces from the NHS, not just children with severe teeth issues.

attributes.action: Temporary ban on United States citizens entering UK
attributes.background: In support and recognition of the US President's ban on countries deemed a "national security risk", we request the government issue a temporary ban on immigration and refugees from the dangerous state of the USA. Statistics show that additional security is required when admitting from this country.
attributes.additional_details:
Murder rate of USA is 3.9 compared with UK 0.9.

Gun death rate of USA is 10.54 compared with UK 0.23.

In 2015, American Dylann Roof killed 9 people in a terrorist attack.

In 1995, American Timothy McVeigh killed 169 people in a terrorist attack.

Between 1978 and 1995, American Ted Kaczynski carried out 16 terrorist bombings, killing 3.

In 2015, American Rizwan Farook killed 14 people in a terrorist attack.

attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.

attributes.action: This nation should prohibit extradition of people to the USA.
attributes.background: The USA has a president who advocates torture and the USA practices imprisonment without trial at Guantanamo Bay. Both these are abhorent to any civilised society.

attributes.action: Make a plastic tax, anything with a plastic wrapping you have to pay a 2p tax
attributes.background: I want to make a plastic tax so all plastic products sold have to pay a 2p plastic tax the money made will go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish and help repopulate the sea with sea life.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 8 billion tonnes of plastic is dumped into the ocean every year. Fish then eat it and then it works it way into our diet. Pvc is the most dangerous man made object and it's 30% of all plastic. It can cause cancer.
Plastic doesn't erode for 450 to 1000 year's

attributes.action: Stop intelligence sharing with the USA and recall the UK Ambassador to the USA.
attributes.background: Suspend intelligence sharing with the USA to ensure that President Trump's new policy of religious discrimination is in no way assisted by the UK.The UK should also condem these actions by recalling the ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
If we should learn anything from the Holocaust it is that descrimination based on religious beliefs is wrong and dangerous. 

"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Socialist. 
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me- and there was no one left to speak for me." Martin Niemöller

attributes.action: Remove the ban on owning Dogo argentinos,
attributes.background: Since 1991 this breed has been banned in the UK under the dangerous dogs act 1991, I propose that this law to either be heavily changed or removed, as people are becoming more aware that with this specific species the dogs themselves are not the problem, but the people that misuse and abuse them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogo argentinos are used as family dogs and guard dogs In their native country, just like GSD's, dobermann's and Rottweilers, they are renowned for their loyalty, and maternal instincts, to ban on dog because it looks menacing is wrong, as it promotes people to keep them for all the wrong reasons, just like every other dog consistent training and socialisation makes them perfect pets and companions, they are smart and are a reward to own because of their close loving bond with their owners.

attributes.action: Make euthanasia legal in the UK in cases of Terminal illnesses & suffering
attributes.background: I've got end stage liver disease. Knowing the death I was facing I've  tried to euthanise myself lots in the last 2 years, almost successful, but sadly not. I'm now using up a bed at a Mental health rehab unit cos they have to protect me from myself, even though it's not a MH issue, & suffering
attributes.additional_details: If an animal was suffering with the pain & symptoms I, and many others are going through daily, keeping the animal alive would result in prosecution for cruelty. We allow animals dignity in dying, so why do we not offer this option, with extremely stringent procedures in place to protect the vulnerable, to fellow humans? I wanted to just fall asleep, instead I'm being forced to suffer Hepatic Encephalopathy & extreme pain, both of which are extremely distressing. Please help change the law!

attributes.action: Ban Diesel Vehicles from City Centers
attributes.background:
This Monday pollution levels in areas of the UK were higher than in parts of Beijing, China.

Diesel vehicles produce 80% of this pollution and cars produce 10x the same pollution from trucks and busses.

I call upon the government to introduce a ban on these vehicles from city centers.
attributes.additional_details:
The ban should be implemented by 2018 as part of the government plan to fight pollution due in April.

The fine should be 10x the current value of the car tax for that vehicle class plus interest. Considerations should be made for the age of the vehicle and the level of pollution so that dirtier cars are more heavily penalised.

 Buses should be mandated to be petrol hybrid or electric and trucks may have an exemption during off-peak hours but companies should be forced to pay an emissions tax.

attributes.action: I want the Jobcentre on Eastern Avenue in Sheffield to be saved
attributes.background:
The S2 area of Sheffield is full of vulnerable people, the support that is provided from the staff in this building is very positive.
Ive attended other jobcentres in the past but they have no connection with the area or the people in it. Eastern Avenue helps you feel like your not just a statistic
attributes.additional_details: Also why is it that in Sheffield only people from our area are going to be affected? People on benefits are in financial difficulty already and can easily walk to their local jobcentre to attend appointments and now only we are going to have to travel by public transport at additional costs to ourselves. I believed that we all had equal rights in this country and all should be treated the same so why only close the one office. Once again the government in this country treat us like a statistic.

attributes.action: Make voting in general elections, and in future referendums compulsory.
attributes.background: Given the historical sacrifices made over any number of years by countless groups and individuals to enfranchise the public, the public should be required to vote, even if the choice is "none of the above". The lack of voting is a distinct failing or our democracy.

attributes.action: Increase the legal age limit in gambling shops to 25
attributes.background: Gambling is like crack cocaine addiction and i have been gambling from 18 and now im 21 turning 22 it has affected my mental health and has ruined my life at a young age so i say that the goverment should put a new age limit on gambling and help people stuck in this addiction
attributes.additional_details: Gambling has ruined my life and im only 21 turning 22 in april the goverment should be strict and look into this matter to stop allowing businesses to create more gambling stations in poor communities and instead build something resourceful for the people in need

attributes.action: Increase government funding for child abuse organisations and therapy services.
attributes.background:
Thousands of children everyday are being abused, in the UK.  
How can we as citizens do nothing to help the vulnerable children being tormented?  How can we let the dreams of the youth be destroyed?
 They will be OUR FUTURE! YOU can make a difference by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details:
-There are currently over 57,000 children identified as needing protection from abuse in the UK
-For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering abuse. 
https://www.nspcc.org.uk/services-and-resources/research-and-resources/statistics/

Remember YOU can help change their lives. So, support this cause.

attributes.action: Cap private rent in line with local council rent. End the housing crisis.
attributes.background: It's time something was done about the astronomical prices of renting a house through a private landlord. Fat cats,are buying all the houses, then renting at inflated prices.  If it was capped in line with council rent. The housing crisis would be helped significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
How are the next generation supposed to get on the housing ladder. Massive private rents mean, no savings.  Therefore no deposit. And in many cases,  living hand to mouth. 
The housing crisis could be eased, if rent wasn't allowed to be inflated by the greedy affluent property owners/developers. House prices would fall and settle at an affordable level.  And the greedy wouldn't want them so much if they weren't allowed to extort money from the less well off

attributes.action: Block the affiliation fee increase of 1150% for rifle clubs and museums
attributes.background:
The home office is running a review of affiliation fees for rifle clubs and museums holding section 5 firearms.
The fee is currently £84, under the new proposal the fee would increase to £1050; an increase of 1150%.
This would have a massive impact on the 38 museums and 61 clubs requiring this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have made it an arduous process to respond, requiring a lengthy form to be downloaded, filled, and emailed back. This is likely to significantly reduce the amount of signatories opposed to this proposition.
The official review is here: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/583035/170110pn_Firearms_Fees_consultation_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Bring democracy to the workplace
attributes.background: Many of us today take great pride having democracy in politics, but one place we have never tried to implement democracy, the place we spend most of our adult life, is the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, I ask for this petition to include workers in each workplace to have the right to,

form a union

elect and deselect members of management

have a say on wages and hours

have a say on how the workplace is run and how the profits are used

allowed to have a weekly/monthly meeting to discuss and vote on anything the workers feel are necessary for the workplace

attributes.action: Have a cross party panel run the nhs rather than the government.
attributes.background: A cross party panel could make long term decisions for the nhs rather than the government making short term decisions based on their political ideology, popularity and what will keep the government in power.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hare coursing
attributes.background: We should lift the ban on hare coursing as it is a great tradition and if we do defend and fight for them such as fox hunting then there will be none of this country's traditions left !!
attributes.additional_details: Once the dog gets hold of the hare it is dead unlike shooting wear you could injure the hare or unsuccessfully kill it straight away

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.
